title: 104_hr804
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Congressional Members' Pension Limitation Act of 1995". It pertains to the Civil Service Retirement System. The Congressional Members' Pension Limitation Act of 1995 amends Section 8334(a) of title 5, United States Code, regarding deductions and withholdings from a Member's pay after completing 5 years of civilian service. Contributions under this act are payable as if the amendment had not been enacted. The Congressional Members' Pension Limitation Act of 1995 amends Section 8334(a) of title 5, United States Code, regarding deductions and withholdings from a Member's pay after completing 5 years of civilian service. The act specifies that deposits cannot be made for services where deductions were not taken under subsection (a)(3) and repeals subsection (c) of section 8333. Additionally, amendments are made to the Thrift Savings Plan for Members with 12 years of service or less where deductions cannot be made. The Congressional Members' Pension Limitation Act of 1995 amends Section 8334(a) of title 5, United States Code, regarding deductions and withholdings from a Member's pay after completing 5 years of civilian service. The act specifies that deposits cannot be made for services where deductions were not taken under subsection (a)(3) and repeals subsection (c) of section 8333. Amendments are made to the Thrift Savings Plan for Members with more than 12 years of service, allowing changes in contribution levels. The Executive Director will prescribe regulations for these changes. The Congressional Members' Pension Limitation Act of 1995 allows for written notice to be given to Members regarding changes in contribution levels under the Thrift Savings Plan after completing 12 years of service. SEC. 3. FEDERAL EMPLOYEES' RETIREMENT SYSTEM. Section 8422(a) of title 5, United States Code, is amended to limit deductions and withholdings from a Member's pay after completing 5 years of civilian service or becoming a Member after the effective date of the Congressional Members' Pension Limitation Act of 1995. The Congressional Members' Pension Limitation Act of 1995 limits deductions and withholdings from a Member's pay after 5 years of civilian service. Any service period exempt from deductions is excluded from benefit calculations. Contributions to the Thrift Savings Plan are restricted for Members with over 12 years of service, with regulations allowing for contribution level changes. The Congressional Members' Pension Limitation Act of 1995 limits deductions from a Member's pay after 5 years of civilian service. Contributions to the Thrift Savings Fund are restricted for Members with over 12 years of service, with provisions for termination of eligibility and written notice requirements. The term 'member service' refers to service as a Member. SEC. 4. MEMBERS UNDER FERS WHO WERE FORMERLY UNDER CSRS.

Amends the Federal Employees' Retirement System Act of 1986 to include provisions for computing benefits for Members transitioning from CSRS to FERS. Regulations for deductions and contributions are specified under subsections (a)(3), (a)(1), and sections 8422(a)(3) and 8432(c)(4) of title 5, United States Code.

SEC. 5. EFFECTIVE DATE. The Act and its amendments will take effect on the first day of the first Congress after the Act's enactment.
